properties.areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Greater Lake Tahoe Area
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 4:00AM PST until January 16 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...Updated snow totals to account for additional
accumulation past 4 am this morning. Adjusted the start time of
the watch from Wednesday night to Thursday morning.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow
accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 55
mph with Sierra ridges over 100 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch,
heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 14 inches
for Truckee and Lake Tahoe, with amounts 18 to 24 inches for the
High Sierra possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph with
Sierra ridges over 100 mph.

* WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST this
morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning
through Thursday evening.

* IMPACTS...Snow covered roads and chain controls are causing slow
travel this morning. Travel could be very difficult to
impossible with the Wednesday night and Thursday storm. Strong
winds could cause tree damage and power outages. Clearly this
would be an unwise and dangerous time to be out on Lake Tahoe
due to rough water and waves up to 5 feet.
properties.instruction:
Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and
car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire
chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives,
travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of
time.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING
